lines.text: Higher frequency caused electrons to be emitted
No matter how intense the light

secText:
Lesson:
1. [OBJ:actsec_x49f:Experiment] with the photoelectric effect by shining light off a piece of metal.
2. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_x459:photoelectric effect].
3. Describe [OBJ:expsec_x461:observations] made of the photoelectric effect.
4. Describe [OBJ:expsec_x462:quantum theory].
5. Describe the [OBJ:expsec_x463:Bohr model] of the atom.
6. [OBJ:expsec_x466:Apply] the concept of the Bohr model of the atom and quantum theory to explain spectrum lines.
7. [OBJ:expsec_x465:Describe] why hydrogen is a model for the Bohr model of the atom.
8. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_photoelectric_work_function_question:determine the kinetic energy] of an emitted electron.
Quick Review: [OBJ:sum_photoelectric:Photons and Photoelectric Effect], [OBJ:sum_bohr_atom:Bohr Atom], [OBJ:sum_orbital_spectrum:Emission Lines and Orbits]
